revised_title: Retarded Interaction Between Neutral Atoms: Three-Body London-van der Waals Interaction
tldr: The authors present a calculation for the three-body interaction energy of neutral atoms, using methods of quantum electrodynamics. They derive an expression for the non-additive interaction energy, which includes both the quasi-static and long-distance interactions. The study is relevant to understanding the attractive forces between solid macroscopic bodies and the validity of the assumption of two-body interactions in molecular physics.
